section.title: Block Storage System Architecture
section.para: The OpenStack Block Storage Service is intended to run on one or more nodes. Block Storage uses a SQL-based central database that is shared by all Block Storage services in the system. The amount and depth of the data fits into a SQL database quite well. For small deployments this seems like an optimal solution. For larger deployments, and especially if security is a concern, Block Storage will be moving towards multiple data stores with some kind of aggregation system.

section.title: Components
section.para:
Below you will a brief explanation of the different components. /- ( LDAP ) [ Auth Manager ] --- | \- ( DB ) | | cinderclient | / \ | [ Web Dashboard ]- -[ API ] -- [ AMQP ] -- [ scheduler ] -- [ volume ] -- ( iSCSI ) \ / | novaclient | | | | [ REST ]
DB: SQL database for data storage. Used by all components (LINKS NOT SHOWN)
Web Dashboard: potential external component that talks to the API
API: component that receives HTTP requests, converts commands and communicates with other components via the queue or HTTP
Auth Manager: component responsible for users/projects/and roles. Can use as back-end a database or LDAP. This is not a separate binary, but rather a python class that is used by most components in the system.
scheduler: decides which host gets each volume
volume: manages dynamically attachable block devices.
